column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/f92555255c2d928ce618d383aa5da46bd195ef43 for binaries and test log.\n

Test plan: either (1) start syncing from scratch or (2) delete the blocks/rev\* files and start a -reindex. In both cases, at any point in time, should the filesize of the blk\* files be a multiple of 16 MiB and the rev\* files a multiple of 1 MiB.\n
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/2d5e0349e19eec9b4c322cdeab37cb0019551fb6 for binaries and test log.\n
The test succeeded under OS X Version 10.8.2\n
Reindex test passes on Fedora 16/17.  Needs windows testing.\n

This is just an optimization, yes?

I think it can wait for 0.8.1.
Indeed an optimization, but one that is easy to test. Ok for 0.8.1.\n
Added a commit to drop the pre-allocated padding when finalizing a block file (=moving to a next one).\n

@gmaxwell Largest advantage is the ability to cat the files together to create a bootstrap.dat :)

... though I'm sure people would otherwise complain about wasted disk space too :p
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/1eb578796c98f457546059b66eb98fd0efc8e690 for binaries and test log.\n
